chapter.title: Resolving Problems following Third Party Product Upgrades

section.title: Change the Version of Eclipse Being Used with JBoss Developer Studio BYOE
section.para: JBoss Developer Studio 7.1 BYOE supports Eclipse Kepler only. If you upgrade the version of Eclipse you are using, you will not be able to use JBoss Developer Studio 7.1 BYOE.
Information about the supported versions of Eclipse for each JBoss Developer Studio BYOE release is provided in the table below.

table.title: JBoss Developer Studio BYOE Releases and Supported Eclipse Versions

section.title: Change the Path of the JVM used to Run JBoss Developer Studio
section.para: JBoss Developer Studio stores the Java virtual machine (JVM) path of the Java developer kit selected during the installation process. Each subsequent time JBoss Developer Studio starts it uses the same JVM path to run.

You might need to change the JVM path because you move the Java developer kit or because you want to use a different Java developer kit. If you change the JVM path, JBoss Developer Studio fails to start. To ensure JBoss Developer Studio starts after changing the JVM path, use the procedure below.

procedure.title: Change the Path of the JVM used to Run JBoss Developer Studio

step.para: Open the path/to/JBoss Developer Studio/studio/jbdevstudio.ini file with a text editor.
The line after -vm provides the path to the JVM of the Java developer kit. Change the path to give the new JVM location.

figure.title: jbdevstudio.ini File Open in a Text Editor

textobject.phrase: Open the path/to/JBoss Developer Studio/studio/jbdevstudio.ini file with a text editor. The line after -vm provides the path to the JVM of the Java developer kit. Change the path to give the new JVM location.

step.para: Save the jbdevstudio.ini file and close the text editor.
